column3: so we are already at an accumulated dividend of 6-10$ in 2022 for the first half. So this is already trading below 50$. So even if worst-case would hit
column4: and we would be at ~12-14 $ eps in the 2nd half of 2022
column5: we are talking 10-17 $ of dividend. If China reopening and the annual peak beginning at the end of Q2 only leads to a stabilized 7-9k$ drewry index and not the spike many experts expect then we would be at ~10-11 $/quarter
column6: so 12-22$ of dividends. And that from a debt-free company with the highest profitability in the sector…
